entry.title: SAP Learning Practice System Stuck on ‚ÄúPlease wait, session is preparing ‚Äù ‚Äì How to Fix It
entry.content:
If you‚Äôre following the SAP Learning  Basic ABAP Programming course or trying to use the SAP BTP ABAP Environment practice system, you might encounter this frustrating issue:

‚ùå‚ÄúPlease wait, session is preparing‚Äù
‚ùåSession keeps loading and never starts

I ran into this myself, so here‚Äôs what‚Äôs actually happening and how to fix it.

What‚Äôs the Problem?

SAP provides a preconfigured practice system for ABAP courses.
This system already contains the data and configuration needed to:

  • Complete exercises from Basic ABAP Programming

  • Experiment with SAP BTP ABAP Environment

However, if your local setup or project connection is incorrect, the session may never finish loading.

Common Reasons Why This Happens

1Ô∏è‚É£Eclipse + ADT Tools Are Not Installed Correctly

To work with the ABAP practice system, you must have:

  • Eclipse IDE installed

  • ABAP Development Tools (ADT) plugin added

üìåSAP‚Äôs official installation guide:
üëâhttps://developers.sap.com/tutorials/abap-install-adt.html

If ADT is missing or outdated, the session will fail silently.

2Ô∏è‚É£Wrong ABAP Service Instance URL (Very Common ‚ùó)

This was the main issue in my case.

When creating an ABAP Cloud Project, Eclipse asks for:

  • ABAP service instance URL

‚ö†Ô∏èIf you accidentally use:

  • An ABAP service URL from your own SAP BTP Trial account

üëâThe SAP Learning practice session will get stuck on ‚ÄúPlease wait, session is loading‚Äù.

‚úÖThe Correct Solution

‚úîÔ∏èStep 1: Use the Provided Practice System URL

When you enrolled in the SAP Learning course, you downloaded a file (usually):

  • s4d_ConfigFile

  • it Includes a README file

üìåInside that README, you‚Äôll find the correct ABAP service instance URL
üëâThis URL is specifically linked to the SAP Learning practice system

‚úîÔ∏èStep 2: Create a NEW ABAP Cloud Project

  • Open Eclipse

  • Create a new ABAP Cloud Project

  • Paste the ABAP service instance URL from the README

  • Do NOT use your own BTP trial URL

Once I did this, the session loaded immediately. ‚úÖ

 

At the end, you will see that the cloud project willl be added

entry.title: SAP Developer News December 18th, 2025
entry.content:

  • Joule Studio Documentation: https://help.sap.com/docs/Joule_Studio?locale=en-US 
  • Webinars on ‚ÄúSAP TechEd Takeaways: Unlocking Agentic AI with Joule Studio in SAP Build‚Äù: https://event.on24.com/eventRegistration/EventLobbyServlet?target=reg20.jsp&eventid=5132226&sessionid=1&key=68EAF8F96311AF0C06B557E4B6FAADAD&groupId=6438260&partnerref=sapcom&sourcepage=register 
  • Maria on ‚ÄúUnlocking SAP BTP‚Äù Podcast: https://pod.link/990578446/episode/ODE0OGVkZGMtMWQyNy00ZDVlLTgxMDYtODI0YjYyZWY4NTYz?view=apps&sort=popularity (podcast) and https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7-DWT6qd15I(YouTube) 
  • Customer use case for building agent for procurement process: https://www.sap.com/assetdetail/2025/12/ecad099c-317f-0010-bca6-c68f7e60039b.html 
  • Setting Up Joule Studio for All Partner Flows and Entitlement Levels (blog): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/setting-up-joule-studio-for-all-partner-flows-and-entitlement-levels/ba-p/14282498\ 
  • Setting Up Joule Studio for All Customer Flows and Entitlement Levels (blog): https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/setting-up-joule-studio-for-all-customer-flows-and-entitlement-levels/ba-p/14240537

GenAI Hub now officially LLM provider for LiteLLM 

  • Documentation: https://sap-contributions.github.io/litellm-agentic-examples/ 
  • Devtoberfest Session on LiteLLM: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/connect-to-generative-ai-hub-with-litellm-and-build-ai-agents-with-crewai/ev-p/14217011 

New release 1.18 of the Terraform Provider for SAP BTP

  • BTP CLI and APIs CodeJam section on extracting the CF API endpoint value https://github.com/SAP-samples/cloud-btp-cli-api-codejam/blob/main/exercises/05-core-services-api-prep/README.md#extracting-the-api-endpoint-value

SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtime trial restrictions lifted 

  • Carolin‚Äôs blog post, updated https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/update-btp-trial-update-cf-runtime-availability/ba-p/14247240  

Devtoberfest Winners Interview - Kanika Chhabra 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Joule Studio Agent Builder Released 

2:42 ABAP Holiday Calendar 2025 

2:58 GenAI Hub now officialy LLM provider for LiteLLM 

4:24 New release 1.18 of the Terraform Provider for SAP BTP 

5:18 CAP Enterprise Analytics 

6:02 SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtime trial restrictions lifted 

6:44 Devtoberfest Winners Interview - Kanika Chhabra 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for December 18th, 2025.

[Daniel] Tomorrow, Joule Studio is expected to release the much-anticipated Agent Builder, where you can create agents for yourself without coding in order to extend Joule. You provide the instructions on the context, as well as a set of skills and other tools, and the agent will analyze, plan, and execute the appropriate actions all by itself. You can specify the LLM you want to use, how much thinking you want the agent to do, as well as several more settings. Included are several features even the beta participants did not get to see, including Vibe coding, where you can use prompts to build your agent step-by-step. You can connect to an MCP server and bring those skills into your agent. And you can create sub-agents that can be called by your main agent. Maria Kondratyeva, a senior product manager who has been working tirelessly to get this release out the door before Christmas, says that you will incur no additional unit cost through the end of January when you deploy and test your new agents. I will leave a set of links to materials about Joule Studio and the Agent Builder, including documentation, webinars, and Maria's recent appearance on the very popular Unlocking SAP BTP podpass. That's a really nice jingle. All the links are in the description. Now that Joule Studio is complete with the Agent Builder and the Skill Builder, I assume now more than ever you'll want to install Joule Studio and get started. Lucky for you, Product Management, specifically Maria and Charin, have produced two blogs on how to set up Joule Studio, one specifically for partners and one specifically for customers. It will show you the SKUs you need for build and Joule. It'll show you the boosters, the formations, the security setup, the roles, and everything that you need for whatever landscape you're using, and whether or not you've already installed Joule Studio or Joule or Process Automation. Links to both of those blogs are also in the description.

[Shilpa] Christmas is around the corner, and the SAP ABAP team brings you ABAP holiday calendar 2025. Check out the LinkedIn post by Sonia, where she highlights the key achievements in the area of ABAP in this year.

[Nora] I have some really cool news for all the SAP AI developers out there. It's basically an early Christmas gift because my friend from development just reached out to me, they told me that generative AI hub is now an official large language model provider for light LLM. Now what is light LLM? Light LLM is an open source library that basically unifies all the different API calls to the different large language model providers. So if it's compatible now with generative AI hub, that means that you can use all the models that we partner with. You can use generative AI hub and light LLM and then all the cool agent development kits, for example, that are compatible with light LLM, and that is really cool because the list is endless. I have those tier because I can't remember everything. So there's LandGraph, Crew AI, Pydantic AI, Google Agent Development Kit, so ADK, OpenAI ADK, AWS TransAgents, Lama Index, Microsoft Agents, and that's not even the whole list. It goes on and on and on. So make sure you check out the documentation that is linked in the show notes wherever they appear. And then also check out the Devtoberfest session with my colleague Karim, who also linked a GitHub repository, where he shows how you can build your own AI agents with generative AI Hub, LightLLM and Crew AI. And yeah, happy coding over the holidays. Happy holidays and happy coding.

[DJ] The team behind the Terraform provider for SAP BTP has an early holiday season present for us. A new version, 1.18, has just landed, bringing fixes, improvements, and new features. Here are just three of the highlights. So first, resources and data sources for destinations are now available. MTLS authentication for service brokers is now supported and there are also some new functions for extracting information from environment instance labels, if you know you know. Check out the full release details for these and more features. By the way, there's already a patch version 1.18.1 which you should use. Links in the description.

[Tom] This month we see a great new CAP add-in in the form of the SAP enterprise analytics add-in. This cool new little feature brings to CAP the support for INA services or information access. These are particularly useful when you want to consume a service from the SAP Analytics Cloud, particularly if you have a calculation view. It's very easy to use: drop in the record referred to module, NPN module, and then simply add some annotations to your data model. It's that simple to now add INA services. So if you're interested in that functionality, be sure to check it out today.

[DJ] A few weeks back, we had a news item on access being temporarily restricted for SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtimes in the trial environment. Just a few days ago, the SAP BTP trial product team announced that these restrictions have been lifted again and Cloud Foundry runtimes are now fully available again in trial. That's great news and another early holiday season present for us. A link to Carolyn's original blog post, which now has an update with these details, is in the description.

[Kanika Chhabra] 'm so happy to have one of our winners from Devtoberfest. So give me this car. I did happy day possible. Oh yeah, she take away it out of that. High ah, so many like that. I did not have a lot of tech background but I was able to do the exercises and MPK, so it was really intuitive and everything was really well developed. So I didn't need to have a lot of background knowledge because one cannot know everything about everything. So it was really very made. That's what's really was raised. And now you are here in Berlin, One TechEd. So what did you like most or what you're looking for to get out of here? So I just got a little interested in SAP Build and I found out all the SAP Build hands-on workshops here, and that really helped me. So I do not have a prior experience on that but I started from scratch here working on the SAP Build and I was actually able to learn a lot and now I have a certification made on SAP BuilderXS. Yeah, so I have like exciting about that. Very impressive. Thank you so much.

entry.title: Joule Capability Documentation Chat
entry.content:
As use cases involving AI become increasingly intertwined with our lives, we have developed a documentation chat for ABAP developers. The documentation chat is available for you to ask questions and find solutions to any ABAP development problem you may have. The conversation with the documentation chat should help you solve your tasks and serve as your helpful guide.

In this blog, we explain the rationale behind the documentation chat, how to use it, and what it offers in SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2511.

 

Rationale

Our primary goal is to provide easy access to the ABAP Cloud product documentation and to enhance the accessibility and findability of our content. Finding documentation has always been an issue that‚Äôs often caused by missing semantics in the provided content. To address this issue, we employ retrieval-augmented generation to deliver relevant information in response to a query.

 

Using the Documentation Chat

The documentation chat is available as a Joule capability in ABAP development tools for Eclipse. For information about using Joule in ABAP development tools for Eclipse, refer to Opening the Joule Chat View.

To use the documentation chat, follow these steps:

  1. In the Joule view, select the button /.
  2. Choose docs.

    If you send the request without a prompt, you receive a description of the capability.
  3. Enter your question in the text area.

     



  4. Press Enter or select the Select message (Enter) button.

    You receive a response to your question. The answer can include text, bullet points, and code examples. Also, references are always provided, allowing you to view the source documentation and verify the given answer.

 

Supported Documentation

As of SAP BTP ABAP Environment 2511, the documentation chat includes the following documentation:

  • ABAP Keyword Documentation
  • ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model
  • ABAP Data Models
  • ABAP Cloud

When chatting with the documentation, you can expect assistance with the topics in the documentation above. It is also possible to ask follow-up questions after an initial question, as the chat history is respected.

In the coming releases, you can expect more to come. Feel free to leave a comment or a like.

entry.title: How to Use SAP Extensibility Wizard in SAP S/4HANA Clean Core
entry.content:
A Comprehensive Guide to Extending SAP S/4HANA with the SAP Extensibility Wizard ‚Äî Without Compromising Your Clean Core

Introduction

Extensibility is a critical aspect of SAP S/4HANA, enabling organizations to tailor the system to their unique business needs while maintaining stability and upgrade readiness. In this guide, we will explore the SAP Extensibility Wizard, a powerful tool designed to help developers extend SAP S/4HANA in a clean and controlled way.

What Is the SAP Extensibility Wizard?

The SAP Extensibility Wizard is a guided tool provided by SAP that simplifies the process of creating extensions. It ensures that developers can add custom functionality without modifying the core system, thereby preserving the clean core principle. This approach guarantees that upgrades remain smooth and that the system stays resilient over time.

Availability: Public Cloud vs. Private Cloud

A common question arises: Is the SAP Extensibility Wizard available only in the Public Cloud, or also in the Private Cloud?

  • Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud ‚Äì Public Edition):
    The wizard is primarily available here. It supports clean-core extensibility and helps organizations build safe, upgrade‚Äëfriendly extensions.
  • Private Cloud / On‚ÄëPremise:
    Extensibility is possible through other approaches such as in‚Äëapp extensibility, ABAP Cloud, and side‚Äëby‚Äëside extensions on SAP BTP. However, the wizard itself is not provided in the same way as in the Public Cloud.

In summary:

  • Public Cloud ‚Üí Wizard available.
  • Private Cloud / On‚ÄëPremise ‚Üí Extensibility options exist, but without the wizard.

Focus of This Blog

This blog will focus on the SAP Extensibility Wizard for SAP S/4HANA Cloud ‚Äì Public Edition.

How to Use the Extensibility Wizard

With the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition extensibility wizard, developers can:

  • Create on‚Äëstack extensions such as custom fields and custom logic.
  • Build side‚Äëby‚Äëside extensions like custom processes using SAP Build Process Automation.

This guided approach ensures that extensions are implemented efficiently, securely, and in alignment with SAP‚Äôs clean‚Äëcore strategy.

Conclusion

The SAP Extensibility Wizard is a key enabler for organizations running SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. By leveraging this tool, businesses can extend their systems with confidence, ensuring that customizations remain upgrade‚Äësafe and future‚Äëproof.

 

Detailed Steps:

Use Case : We will create a sales order approval process .

1. Navigate to SAP S4/HANA Fiori Launchpad.

1.1 Select Business Application Manage Sales Orders. 

1.2  Navigate to Create Extension

 

1.3 In this case , we will select custom process.

The process can start based on various triggers 

1.4 Select Business Event from SAP S4/HANA, that Triggers the process

1.5 Select Event Object

1.6 Select the SalesOrder create event.

1.7 Click Preview to see all the options you selected on previous screens, and make any necessary corrections.

1.8 Click Create , to create the process in SAP Build.

1.9 The extension is now available and can also be opened in SAP Build.

1.10 When you select Open Extension, the system launches another tab that opens the process.

1.11 The Process Automation project overview page is now displayed. Select SalesOrder Approval.

1.12 Extension is now openEd in SAP Build , Start design of the process.

The Business context is carried over from SAP S4/HANA to SAP Build .

1.13 You can add an action, form , or approval . To get further details on the sales order, you need to call an action .

1.14 In this use case , we will call sales order read API , to fetch the sales order details.

1.15 Browse the library to search for  the relevant APIs .

1.16 Select read sales order API to get details of the sales order, The business context and system ID were automatically pulled in from SAP S4/HANA .

1.17 The action to read the sales order has now been added . Now users can design the process according to their needs. The user now wants to initiate a workflow that sends an email to the approver for sales order approval .

1.18 The email will include the sales order details , allowing approver to review and approve it . we're utilizing AI to generate the process , Enter the prompt to add an approval step and send the sales order details to the approver via email.

1.19 AI has now added the process step to read the sales order and email, The sales order details to the approver .

 

Conclusion

The SAP Extensibility Wizard empowers organizations running SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to extend their systems safely and efficiently, without compromising the clean core. By leveraging guided tools for custom fields, logic, and side‚Äëby‚Äëside processes, businesses can innovate while staying upgrade‚Äëready.

Extensibility in SAP is not just about adding features‚Äîit‚Äôs about doing so in a way that keeps your system future‚Äëproof. With the wizard, you can confidently build the extensions your business needs today, while ensuring smooth upgrades tomorrow.

entry.title: 2025 set the pace, 2026 wins the race: ABAP AI with Joule, VS Code, and CCM
entry.content:
Back from a blissful Christmas/New Year reset and sprinting to the keyboard‚Äîtime to swap hot cocoa for hot commits. 2025 made the promise real: prompts ‚Üí projects, minutes not weeks, and Joule as ABAP‚Äôs turbo button. Now we scale in 2026: agentic flows over widgets, VS Code first‚Äëclass, and AI‚Äëdriven Custom Code Migration as the headline act. Goodbye 2025, and happy New Year 2026‚Äîlet‚Äôs ship.

What happened in 2025 and what are the peaks of 2026? Stay with me for a full retrospective of ABAP AI in 2025 and sneak preview into 2026:

Build fast (Joule on the keyboard)

  • Real-time help that knows ABAP Cloud: context-aware suggestions, code prediction, and clean-core patterns.
  • Explain anything: ABAP and CDS code explained in plain language‚Äîno more reverse-engineering marathons.
  • Tests on tap: Instant unit tests for ABAP and CDS.
  • Roll your own AI: ABAP AI SDK powered by ISLM to plug governed GenAI into ABAP scenarios.

Ship whole apps (from help to ‚Äúdone‚Äù)

  • OData UI Service from Scratch Wizard + Joule chat: full RAP apps in minutes‚Äîentities, behavior, service binding, OData.
  • RAP Business Logic Prediction: validations and determinations generated in-context, following RAP best practices.
  • OData consumption in seconds: /consume generates tailored client proxy code and examples.
  • Extensibility AI Assistant (Public Cloud): add custom fields, find business contexts, enable usage, locate value helps, discover BADIs‚Äîby asking.

Migrate with confidence (legacy to S/4HANA-ready)

  • /docs for migration: chat with SAP Help, simplification items, and cookbooks‚Äîanswers tied to your scenario.
  • Explain legacy code: purpose, flow, data dependencies‚Äîthousands-line ‚Äúmystery‚Äù programs, understood in seconds.
  • Explain ATC findings: root cause, business impact, recommended APIs, and fix examples for S/4 readiness checks.
  • Custom Code Migration AI Assistant (Private 2025): bring all of the above into your S4/HANA simplification with 2025 PCE delivery
  • Next up: the standalone Custom Code Migration Application on BTP ABAP connects to any ERP (on-prem or cloud) for RISE and deliver code adaptation proposals with SAP S/4HANA 2025 FPS01.

Availability and how to start

  • Joule for Developers is free for another year: 8019124 (customers), 8019541 (TDD partners). Available for BTP ABAP, S/4HANA Cloud Public, and S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (2025). Read more on The AI Revolution Accelerates ‚Äì Chapter 2 Awaits.
  • Use the ABAP AI SDK to build, manage and operate your own AI scenarios in your ABAP developments.
  • Adopt the Custom Code Migration AI Assistant (Private 2025) and the BTP-based Custom Code Migration Application for cross-system analysis soon to come
  • Explore SAP Help and Bolg community content from Sonja Lienard and Alexander Rother.

A sneak-peek of 2026

2025 proved ABAP AI. 2026 scales it‚Äîfast. The shift: from features to frameworks, from capabilities to flows, from PoCs to enterprise-grade AI across the ABAP stack.

Agentic ABAP AI: workflows, not widgets

  • Agent-led flows own the whole task: understand ‚Üí transform ‚Üí test ‚Üí enforce clean core.
  • ABAP Agentic AI Flow and side-by-side agents become standard; existing use cases migrate into agents available also for older SAP Cloud ERP Private versions.
  • Aligned with Joule‚Äôs agentic direction and interoperable with industry patterns.

Joule everywhere: VS Code goes first class

  • VS Code support: ABAP language server, ABAP MCP server, native Joule for Developers.
  • One feel across Eclipse, VS Code, and future cloud IDEs‚ÄîAI where devs actually work.
  • Next J4D wave: sharper suggestions, clearer explanations, feedback loops

Flagship 2026: AI-driven Custom Code Migration (CCM)

  • Double down on custom code adaptation proposal, follow up by clean-core recommendations, fit-to-standard analysis, clean core propose transformations, and code explain extension to more ABAP legacy objects
  • Deep agentic integration and customer-ready RISE scenarios‚ÄîCCM is the hero use case.

Foundations level up: SDK, ABAP LLMs, benchmarking

  • AI SDK adds orchestration, structured outputs, streaming, and broader compatibility.
  • SAP-trained ABAP LLMs become consumable for higher-fidelity code understanding and generation.
  • Benchmarking and telemetry are standardized and automated for accuracy, price, and performance.

ABAP-tuned LLMs: SAP doubles down via AI Core

  • Continue doubling down on ABAP AI models that bake in ABAP/CDS knowledge, SAP semantics, and clean‚Äëcore patterns for higher‚Äëfidelity understanding and safer code generation.
  • Delivered through AI Core: enterprise governed access to manage the execution and operations of AI assets in a standardized, scalable, and hyperscaler-agnostic manner. 
  • Plug-and-play integration: native hooks in Joule for Developers and the ABAP AI SDK, plus standardized benchmarking and telemetry as usage scales.

Bottom line for 2026

That‚Äôs the play: ship early, scale smart, keep the core clean‚Äîagentic flows doing the heavy lifting, Joule first‚Äëclass in VS Code, and AI‚Äëdriven CCM leading the migration sprint while ABAP‚Äëtuned models via AI Core keep it governed. From prompts to production‚Äîminutes, not weeks.  

Happy New Year 2026‚Äî If 2025 unlocked ABAP AI‚Äôs potential, 2026 will make ABAP AI the core of ABAP development.

entry.title: Creating Material Master Data in SAP S/4HANA Using RAP and EML .
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA, Article (Material) Master Data is one of the most critical master data objects, serving as the foundation for logistics, sales, inventory management, and financial processes. Every procurement transaction, sales order, stock movement, or valuation posting ultimately depends on the correctness and consistency of material master data.

Traditionally, material master records are created using standard transactions such as MM01 or by leveraging classic approaches like BAPIs and IDocs. While these methods are reliable, they are not always well-suited for modern application development, especially when building custom, extensible, and clean-core‚Äìcompliant solutions.

With the introduction of the RESTful ABAP Programming Model (RAP), SAP provides a standardized and future-ready way to build transactional applications using CDS views, behavior definitions, and Entity Manipulation Language (EML). RAP allows developers to model business objects declaratively while handling transactional consistency, validations, and authorizations in a structured manner.

In this article, we focus on creating Article (Material) Master Data using RAP and EML, by building an unmanaged RAP Business Object on top of standard SAP interface views such as I_Product, I_ProductDescription, and I_ProductPlant. Instead of directly calling classic BAPIs like BAPI_MATERIAL_SAVEDATA, the solution leverages EML operations on I_ProductTP to create and extend product data in a clean and controlled way.

The implementation demonstrates:

  • How to model a root CDS view entity for product creation
  • How to enrich it with UI annotations and value helps
  • How to define behavior logic for create, update, and custom actions
  • How to use EML to create product header data, descriptions, and plant extensions
  • How to handle validations, updates, and controlled operations within RAP behavior handlers

This approach enables the creation of a modern, API-driven, and extensible material master solution, which can easily be consumed by custom UIs, Fiori Elements, or external integrations‚Äîwhile remaining aligned with SAP‚Äôs clean-core strategy.

At the end of our development our RAP UI app will look like :

Note: Data is blurred out .

 

Step 1: Create a root CDS view entity

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Product demo with EML'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true
@Search.searchable: true
define root view entity ZI_product_demo as select from I_Product as product
association [0..1] to I_ProductDescription as _descrp
on product.Product = _descrp.Product
association [0..*] to I_ProductPlant as _plante
                   on product.Product = _plante.Product
{
    key Product,
    IndustrySector,
    ProductType,
    BaseUnit,
    ProductGroup,
    PackagingMaterialGroup,
    
    _plante.Plant,
    
    _descrp.Language,
    _descrp.ProductDescription // Make association public
}

Step 2: Create a metadata extension for UI

@Metadata.layer: #CUSTOMER
@UI: {
    headerInfo: {
        typeName: 'Manage Products',
        typeNamePlural: 'Products',
        title: { type: #STANDARD, value: 'Product' },
        description: { value: 'ProductDescription' }
    }
}
annotate entity ZI_product_demo with
{
  .facet: [
    { id: 'ProductData', purpose: #STANDARD, type: #IDENTIFICATION_REFERENCE, label: 'Product Details', position: 10 }
  ]

  : { lineItem: [ { position: 10 },
                     { type: #FOR_ACTION, dataAction: 'extendplant', label: 'Extend Plant' } ],
        identification: [ { position: 10, label: 'Product' } ],
        selectionField: [ { position: 10 } ]  }
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_PRODUCT_VH' ,
                                                    element: 'Product' } } ]
  Product;
  : { lineItem: [ { position: 20 } ],
       identification: [ { position: 20, label: 'Industry Sector' } ],
       selectionField: [ { position: 20 } ] }
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_IndustrySector_VH' ,
                                                          element: 'IndustrySector' } } ]
  IndustrySector;

  : { lineItem: [ { position: 30 } ],
         identification: [ { position: 30, label: 'Product Type' } ],
         selectionField: [ { position: 30 } ] }
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_ProductType_VH' ,
                                                          element: 'ProductType' } } ]
  ProductType;

  : { lineItem: [ { position: 40 } ],
         identification: [ { position: 40, label: 'Base Unit' } ],
         selectionField: [ { position: 40 } ] }
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_BaseUnit_VH' ,
                                                          element: 'BaseUnit' } } ]
  BaseUnit;

  : { lineItem: [ { position: 50 } ],
         identification: [ { position: 50, label: 'Product Group' } ],
         selectionField: [ { position: 50 } ] }
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_ProductGroup_VH' ,
                                                         element: 'ProductGroup' } } ]

  ProductGroup;

  : { lineItem: [ { position: 60 } ],
         identification: [ { position: 60, label: 'Product Description' } ],
         selectionField: [ { position: 60 } ] }
  ProductDescription;

  : { lineItem: [ { position: 70 } ],
       identification: [ { position: 70, label: 'Packaging Material Group' } ],
       selectionField: [ { position: 70 } ] }
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_PackMaterialGroup_VH' ,
                                                        element: 'PackagingMaterialGroup' } } ]
  PackagingMaterialGroup;

  : { lineItem: [ { position: 80 } ],
       identification: [ { position: 80, label: 'Plant' } ],
       selectionField: [ { position: 80 } ] }
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_PLANT_VH' ,
                                                        element: 'Plant' } } ]

  Plant;

  : { lineItem: [ { position: 90 } ],
      identification: [ { position: 90, label: 'Language' } ],
      selectionField: [ { position: 90 } ] }
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_Language_VH' ,
                                                        element: 'Language' } } ]
  Language;
}

Since we are adding a extension to plant feature in our app we will need an abstract entity for plant.

Step 3: create abstract entity for plant

@EndUserText.label: 'abstract entity fo plant'
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true

define abstract entity ZI_PLANT_PARAM

{
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{  entity: {   name: 'ZC_MAT_PLANT_VH' ,
                                                        element: 'Plant' } } ]  
        plant : werks_d;
}

Step 4: Behavior definition will look like this, note that in action we have to specify the abstract entity name for plant extension feature :

unmanaged implementation in class zbp_i_product_demo unique;
strict ( 2 );

define behavior for ZI_product_demo //alias <alias_name>
late numbering
lock master
authorization master ( global )
{
  create;
  update;
  delete;

  action extendplant parameter ZI_PLANT_PARAM result [1] $self;
  field ( readonly ) Plant;
  field ( readonly : update  ) Product,  ProductType, IndustrySector , PackagingMaterialGroup, Language;
  field ( mandatory : create ) BaseUnit , Language , ProductDescription, PackagingMaterialGroup,
                               IndustrySector, ProductType;
}

Step 5 : In the behavior implementation class we have to implement create , update, delete & extendplant method .

METHOD create.
    DATA lt_create_product TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE I_ProductTP_2.

*-- Read the data from app
    DATA(ls_entity) = entities[ 1 ].
    lv_product_type = ls_entity-ProductType.

    lt_create_product = VALUE #( (  %cid = 'product1'

                                  Product = ls_entity-Product
                                  ProductType = ls_entity-ProductType
                                  BaseUnit =  ls_entity-BaseUnit
                                  IndustrySector = ls_entity-IndustrySector
                                  PackagingProductGroup = ls_entity-PackagingMaterialGroup
                                  %control-Product = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                  %control-ProductType = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                  %control-BaseUnit = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                  %control-IndustrySector = if_abap_behv=>mk-on
                                  %control-PackagingProductGroup = if_abap_behv=>mk-on )  ).


*-- Call EML to replace BAPI_MATERIAL_SAVEDATA.
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_ProductTP_2 PRIVILEGED
           ENTITY Product
           CREATE FROM lt_create_product
           CREATE BY \_ProductDescription
           FIELDS ( Language ProductDescription  ) WITH VALUE #( (   %cid_ref = 'product1'
                                                                     Product = ls_entity-Product
                                                                     %target = VALUE #( (
                                                                     %cid = 'desc1'
                                                                     Product = ls_entity-Product
                                                                  Language = ls_entity-Language
                                                        ProductDescription = ls_entity-ProductDescription
                                                              )    ) ) )
                                                               MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped)
                                                               REPORTED DATA(ls_reported)
                                                               FAILED DATA(ls_failed)..
  ENDMETHOD.


  METHOD update.
    DATA(ls_update_entity) = entities[ 1 ].

*-- Fetch existing data from database.
    SELECT SINGLE a~ProductType,
                  a~BaseUnit,
                  a~ProductGroup,
                  a~IndustrySector,
                  a~PackagingMaterialGroup,
                  b~ProductDescription,
                  b~Language
            FROM I_Product AS a
      INNER JOIN i_productdescription AS b
              ON a~Product = b~Product
           WHERE a~product EQ _update_entity-%key-Product
           INTO (ls_exist_product).

*-- Call EML to modify Product header data
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF I_ProductTP_2 PRIVILEGED
    ENTITY Product
    UPDATE FIELDS ( BaseUnit ProductGroup )
    WITH VALUE #( ( %key-Product = ls_update_entity-Product
                    BaseUnit = COND #( WHEN ls_update_entity-BaseUnit IS INITIAL THEN ls_exist_product-BaseUnit
                                       ELSE ls_update_entity-BaseUnit )

                    ProductGroup = COND #( WHEN ls_update_entity-ProductGroup IS INITIAL THEN ls_exist_product-ProductGroup
                                           ELSE ls_update_entity-ProductGroup )
                     ) )

*-- Call EML to modify product description
     ENTITY ProductDescription
     UPDATE FIELDS ( ProductDescription )
     WITH VALUE #( ( %key-Product = ls_update_entity-Product
                     %key-Language = ls_exist_product-Language
                     ProductDescription = COND #( WHEN ls_update_entity-ProductDescription IS INITIAL THEN ls_exist_product-ProductDescription
                                                  ELSE ls_update_entity-ProductDescription  ) ) )
    MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped)
    REPORTED DATA(ls_reported)
    FAILED DATA(ls_failed).
  ENMETHOD.


  METHOD delete.
*-- Turn off delete functionality
    APPEND VALUE #( %tky = keys[ 1 ]-%tky ) TO failed-zi_product_demo.
    APPEND VALUE #( %tky = keys[ 1 ]-%tky
                    %msg = new_message_with_text( severity = if_abap_behv_message=>severity-error
                                                  text = 'Delete functionality is not enabled' )
                   ) TO reported-zi_product_demo.
  ENDMETHOD.


  METHOD read.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD lock.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD extendplant.

    DATA : lt_product TYPE TABLE FOR READ RESULT zi_product_demo.

    DATA(lt_keys) = keys.
    LOOP AT keys  ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_keys>).

      DATA(lv_plant) = <lfs_keys>-%param-plant.
      DATA(lv_product) = <lfs_keys>-%key-Product.

    ENDLOOP.

*-- Modify the entity with plant
    MODIFY ENTITY I_ProductTP_2
        CREATE BY \_ProductPlant AUTO FILL CID WITH VALUE #( ( Product = lv_product
            %target = VALUE #( ( Product = lv_product
                                   Plant = lv_plant  ) ) ) )
    MAPPED DATA(ls_mapped)
    REPORTED DATA(ls_reported)
    FAILED DATA(ls_failed).

*-- Read the changed data.
    READ ENTITIES OF zi_product_demo IN LOCAL MODE
    ENTITY ZI_product_demo
    ALL FIELDS WITH
    CORRESPONDING #( lt_keys )
     RESULT DATA(lt_result).

    result = VALUE #( FOR ls IN lt_result ( %tky = ls-%tky
                                            %param = ls ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.

ENDCLASS.

entry.title: SAP Developer News January 8th,, 2026
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

CAP December 2025 release 

  • CAP December 2025 release notes https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/releases/dec25  
  • SAP Developer News episode covering Status-Transition Flows and the CAP November 2025 release https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BkCPoH7VKHg  
  • A simple exploration of status transition flows in CAP (blog post) https://qmacro.org/blog/posts/2025/12/08/a-simple-exploration-of-status-transition-flows-in-cap/  
  • Axiom AXI001 What not how https://github.com/qmacro/capref/blob/main/axioms/AXI001.md  
  • A new Hands-on SAP Dev mini-series on the core expression language in CDS (blog post) https://qmacro.org/blog/posts/2025/12/09/a-new-hands-on-sap-dev-mini-series-on-the-core-expression-language-in-cds/  
  • CDS expressions in CAP - Under the hood - Part 1 (upcoming live stream) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aiE20i5BP70  
  • Best Practice BES006 Compose with reuse in mind https://github.com/qmacro/capref/blob/main/bestpractices/BES006.md  
  • The OData "Common" Vocabulary's FieldControlType definitions https://sap.github.io/odata-vocabularies/vocabularies/Common.html#FieldControlType  

2025 set the pace, 2026 wins the race: ABAP 

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/2025-set-the-pace-2026-wins-the-race-abap-ai-with-joule-vs-code-and-ccm/ba-p/14302433 

What‚Äôs New in SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì 2025-Q4 

  • Overview: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-sap-hana-cloud-december-2025/ba-p/14295366 
  • New Machine Learning, NLP and AI features in SAP HANA Cloud 2025 Q4: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/new-machine-learning-nlp-and-ai-features-in-sap-hana-cloud-2025-q4/ba-p/14293152 
  • SAP CodeJam on Foundations of AI applications with the SAP HANA Cloud -- ML, Vectors, Knowledge Graph: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-codejam-blog-posts/sap-codejam-topics/ba-p/221407#codejam1  

 Application Vulnerability Report 

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-application-vulnerability-report-for-cloudfoundry-applications/ba-p/14281684 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 CAP December 2025 release 

6:20 2025 set the pace, 2026 wins the race: ABAP 

7:22 What‚Äôs New in SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì 2025-Q4 

9:36 Application Vulnerability Report 

10:32 Devtoberfest Winner Jose Pereira 

Transcript

00;00;00;08 - 00;00;05;26

This is the SAP Developer News for January 8th, 2026.

00;00;05;29 - 00;00;09;26

Over the holiday period, the CAP team delivered a nice present for us.

00;00;10;00 - 00;00;44;20

The December 2025 release. Let's take a quick look through the highlights. But before we do, let's check out the new FEATURE STATUS BADGES that are appearing more and more - in fact, there are a few in the notes for this release.

As we all know our Greek alphabet, we can correctly surmise that while BETA features are post-experimental and still possibly subject to change ... GAMMA features, not to be confused with the type of radiation that created The Incredible Hulk, are pretty much finalised and ready to use & test thoroughly.

00;00;44;22 - 00;01;19;15

Two such features that are at GAMMA level in this release are Status-Transition Flows and Declarative Constraints.

We covered Status-Transition Flows in a previous news item for the previous release, and there's an overview in this blog post we have for you.

So let's instead take a brief look at the super exciting Declarative Constraints. There are new possibilities with the @assert annotation to define complex constraints, in your CDS model.

00;01;19;18 - 00;01;50;01

That's right, declaratively. We should always strive to PUSH outwards, pushing logic up into the declarative model, and queries & data manipulation down to the database, which goes hand in hand with CAP‚Äôs axiom WHAT NOT HOW.

The conditions are expressed in another domain specific language in CDS - CXL - CDS Expression Language.

00;01;50;01 - 00;02;19;07

And, almost as if we'd planned it, there‚Äôs a new Hands-on SAP Dev live stream series on CXL starting Friday next week, with me and one of the fab members of the CAP compiler team, Patrice. Don't miss it!

CAP‚Äôs support for hierarchical tree views has just become a lot more streamlined, with a new @hierarchy annotation replacing a ton of OData specific ones.

00;02;19;08 - 00;02;46;26

Now that's what I call simple reuse, and cap is an incredibly important idea and a best practice to add in that context. There's a new command CDS export, with which you can create API client packages from your CDS service. Definitions. The output is a full featured cap reuse package that can be published to and pulled from npm registries.

00;02;46;29 - 00;03;15;23

Now that‚Äôs what I call simple.

Reuse in CAP is an incredibly important idea, and best practice too, and in that context, there‚Äôs a new command cds export with which you can create API client packages from your CDS service definitions; the output is a full-featured CAP reuse package that can be published to and pulled from NPM registries. If exporting via EDMX is the lossy MP3 audio format, then cds export gives us a lossless transfer, more like FLAC.

By the way, if you're interested to learn more about reuse in CAP, with NPM packages, we've a new blog post series Modules, modularity & reuse in CDS models which you might be interested in, with parts 1 and 2 already published.

00;03;15;26 - 00;03;45;29

In the CDS Language & Compiler topic, there's an enhancement that will appeal to those of you who develop and serve multiple frontends from the app/ directory. Now CDS file content from all ./app/* subdirectories will be fetched and loaded (say, with cds build or cds serve) instead of just from the app/ directory itself. This means we don't have to use an index.cds file in the app/ directory to import what we need.

00;03;46;01 - 00;04;19;26

Staying in the CDS Language & Compiler area, there's another enhancement that allows us to use symbols not only for enums defined in CDS, but now also for enums in OData annotations. The example in the release notes in Capire is great, because not only does it illustrate the enhancement, but it also causes the curious amongst us to use our brains and go to find out where the relation between 1 and Readonly, and between 7 and Mandatory, is defined.

00;04;19;26 - 00;04;51;01

And of course it's in OData's ‚ÄúCommon‚Äù vocabulary, contributed by SAP.

In the Node.js runtime topic, it is now possible to make direct CRUD requests on draft-enabled entities; for example, instead of the EDIT-PATCH-SAVE sequence, you can now just send a direct UPDATE request.

Also, event queue processing has been consolidated into a default queue ... and custom queues, and there has been a change to the db-related guarantee, from ‚Äòat least once‚Äô to ‚Äòexactly once‚Äô.

00;04;51;01 - 00;05;23;03

Related guarantee from at least once to exactly once. Finally, in the NodeJS runtime topic, there has been some cleanup of the model reflection APIs. Some function uses have been deprecated and the text entities are now available in a text property of the corresponding localized entity. Moving to the Java runtime topic, there are some important changes related to deep updates for draft enabled entities.

00;05;23;06 - 00;05;52;09

Finally in the Node.js runtime topic, there has been some clean up of the model reflection APIs. Some function usages have been deprecated, and the .texts entities are now available in a texts property of the corresponding localised entity.

In the Java runtime, there are some important changes related to deep updates for draft-enabled entities.

00;05;52;11 - 00;06;23;25

Now, as well as support for active entities, there‚Äôs also deep update support for inactive entities too, as long as the keys are included.

Additionally, there‚Äôs a new as(String alias) method on the CqnValue interface; with that, it‚Äôs possible to create aliased values directly, making it easier to build queries with aliased values.

In the Tools topic, there‚Äôs a Kyma convenience now for the cds up command; if your project contains Helm deployment resources, and no mta.yaml file, then you don't need to specify the --to k8s option explicitly any more.

And last but not least, in the Plugins topic, the Node.js plugin @Pa_Vi/cds-rfc now supports multitenancy.

There are links to everything I've mentioned, and more ... in the description.

00;06;23;27 - 00;06;45;04

In this blog post, Simona reflects on how 2025 laid the groundwork for AI powered ABAP development and gives us a clear line of sight into where things are going in 2026. One big highlight from the blogpost is that Joule for developers will remain free for another year, giving us more time to explore AI assisted coding in real projects.

00;06;45;07 - 00;07;15;00

The blog post walks us through the evolution of AI last year and what's to come. Smart tooling with the AI workflow, deeper integration with VS code, and a renowned focus on custom code migration using AI, all designed to help developers be more productive and modernize their code bases. And that's really the strategy going into 2020. Shipping early, scaling smart, and keeping the ABAP core clean in 2025 is about unlocking what I can do.

00;07;15;07 - 00;07;22;12

Then 2026 will make ABAP AI the core of AI about development.

00;07;22;15 - 00;07;54;05

The Q4 2025 release of SAP HANA Cloud brings many updates designed to streamline your workflow and unlock new possibilities. Let‚Äôs dive into what‚Äôs new.

Let's start with SAP HANA Cloud Central, which now supports background processing for long-running SQL statements that continue even after closing your browser. A new consolidated view of HDI schemas and containers provides quick access to HDI artifacts and their metadata.

00;07;54;08 - 00;08;36;26

SAP Business Data Cloud integration is streamlined‚Äîdata products are automatically exposed as virtual tables, reducing manual setup and accelerating data reuse.

Calculation view modeling adds column lineage via SQL table functions, dynamic input parameters for MDS cube conversions, and runtime-evaluated restricted columns. Joins are enhanced with support for left outer joins in star joins.

This release introduces the ability to transform property graphs into semantic knowledge graphs without requiring redesign of data models, enabling flexible switching between paradigms on the same data for your use cases.

00;08;36;28 - 00;09;10;09

For developers and data scientists, AI and machine learning capabilities have undergone significant enhancements. The new Unified Time Series procedure provides a consistent interface across algorithms, simplifying development. Text embedding models have been improved to reduce output dimensions without sacrificing accuracy, and the new cross and convert model. In an NLP service ensures more precise search results. Ranking with the Hana Experiment Monitor user interface.

00;09;10;11 - 00;09;34;05

The final SAP CodeJam of 2025 took place in Istanbul, with a focus on AI in SAP HANA Cloud. The next one will happen in February in Berlin, and rest assured, it will be updated with some of these cool new enhancements. You can request this CodeJam topic in your location also!

00;09;34;08 - 00;09;38;22

Also see all the.

00;09;38;25 - 00;10;08;14

Why not start the year off right? With the cleanest, safest applications you can. That's what the new application vulnerability report service for on SAP. BTP focuses on Cloud Foundry applications. Is exactly for this new service. Now in beta will allow you to scan your running applications on SAP, BTP on a regular basis and look for critical vulnerabilities. Don't wait until something happens to one of your applications to find out that there's a vulnerability in it.

00;10;08;16 - 00;10;31;19

Be proactive and find out in advance. So I encourage you to check out this brand new service. I'll put the link to the blog post that describes it, as well as goes through the setup process. It's very easy to use and you can start getting your reports today, so I would encourage you to do so.

00;10;31;22 - 00;11;00;19

So my bedroom. So I hear that there were the two of us and have got a special leftovers right, to work with the community that long. You know what you want, right? Nope. There was kind of a learning journey that you did. Yeah. Our bosses always incentive us to look forward. And WhatsApp has to offer. Even if we don't do work on it.

00;11;00;21 - 00;11;22;13

It's not right. But if you know it, and that exists once the opportunity arrives, you already know it, then you can hit the ground running. Yeah. That's fantastic. So basically, as part of this learning journey, studying your cell phone, it's a party that you took part in. Definitely. Yeah. So what was your favorite aspect of that for week?

00;11;22;15 - 00;11;52;13

Yeah. I think, seeing the videos, making the quizzes, I was amazed with Joe. Yeah. Cool. Yeah. That's really cool. So did you manage to attend any of the videos live, or are you watching? Sort of, recording? Nope. I had done both. That's dedication. That's real dedication. The journey was only, to learn. We have, a few months just learning and doing things.

00;11;52;15 - 00;12;18;14

Yeah. Yeah. But in terms of, you know, what? What motivates you to keep doing. What is it? What's the secret? I think I'm a person that really wants to know more every time and keep searching and work for we can do. And, how can we automate our work? The aims, I think the I think it was all about that shit.

00;12;18;15 - 00;12;31;06

Oh, yeah. Yeah. How can we make our develop life better? Easier? And also curiosity driving. We got to learn. That's why I think that's the best definition of what developed. Yeah. Pedro, thanks very much. Thank you.

entry.title: Custom Entity With Actions
entry.content:
What is a Custom Entity in RAP? 

In the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), a Custom Entity is a CDS entity that does not map to a database table. Instead, it represents virtual data provided by custom ABAP logic. It is used when: 

  • You need to expose calculated or external data. 
  • You want to integrate non-database sources (e.g., APIs, external systems). 
  • You require custom operations beyond standard CRUD. 

Adding an Action to a Custom Entity allows you to trigger specific business operations directly from the UI. 

Now we will look at one practical example for Custom Entity with an Action in RAP, where the action will be performed based on the user click on the button called CustomAction , when user clicks on it the icon will be changed. 

First, we will begin by creating a database table with the fields shown in the screenshot below. 

Next, we will create a Custom Entity and define its implementation class, as the Custom Entity will be realized through the logic implemented in that class "ZGA_CL_QRY_PRVD_C_ACT". 

Now, we will implement the logic in the class and use the mandatory interface IF_RAP_QUERY_PROVIDER to handle data retrieval for the Custom Entity. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

To adjust the data, we have implemented another class named ZGA_CL_BS_DEMO_ADJUST_DATA. 

Our next task is to create a Behavior Definition for the Custom Entity ZGA_I_CUST_ACT_DEMO to enable actions and logic implementation.

Next, we dive into implementing the Behavior Definition logic in the class ZBP_GA_I_CUST_ACT_DEMO. 

The class shown below serves as the buffer class, which we have utilized in our Behavior Implementation class.

Our next task is to create the Service Definition and Service Binding, enabling the UI to consume the Custom Entity and its actions.

 

Output:

Once an instance is selected, clicking CustomAction will dynamically update the icon, as displayed in the screenshot. 

The Reset button is used to restore all icons to their original state. 

Conclusion 

Custom Entities with Actions in SAP RAP provide a powerful way to implement dynamic, user-driven functionality without relying on database persistence. In this example, we demonstrated how to create a Custom Entity and enhance it with two actions. 

By leveraging actions, you can enrich your applications with flexible business logic, improve user engagement, and maintain a clean separation between UI and backend logic. This approach is ideal for scenarios where you need virtual data handling combined with interactive operations.
